answers.answer: 36 weeks is full term so hopefully everything will be fine. Maybe she will wait another week and let baby grow just a bit more?
Hopefully...but im worried my baby might be underweight too...

I had this happen to me with my first pregnancy. At about 32 weeks my fluids were low. I then started gettig Non stress test twice a week and my daughter was very small as well so they kept changing my due date. I also had preeclampsia so was put on bed rest. I went in the day before my newest due date and they told me I had to be induced. Turned out after I delivered my daughter that I should have been induced two weeks earlier and that I was just having a small baby. She was 5lbs 6oz when born and perfectly healthy. I would try and relax and take it easy and drink plenty of water in thw meantime. Hope everything goes smoothly for you!!! Best of luck with everything.

You didnt have to leave your baby at the hospital? Thanks for sharing your experience :) it keeps my hopes up, i go twice a week to get my babys heart monitor and an ultrasound, today i have an ultrasound and hopefully everything is stable..and i havent lost more fluid...

question: Ob told me i have low fluid and baby is measuring small, im 36 weeks pregnant and i am measuring 33 :/ she said if my fluid gets any lower she will probably need to get baby out sooner. Im scared..has anyone experienced this before?..i want to be able to take baby home with me but im not sure thats possible if they take her out already :/
title: worried :/
